intro: Brunfelsia calycina var. lindeniana, commonly known as the purple morning glory, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes nightshade plants, and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and have a velvety texture, while its flowers range in color from white to deep purple. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds, contributing to its natural distribution in the wild.
